Reviews.Title: “Good value, good base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSue5058
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a bargain weekend break found on Travelzoo in March. I realised this was not a central hotel and we planned accordingly. Our taxi from the airport dropped us late at night at the rather unnattractive street entrance (refuse bins and a forbidding iron gate) but we climbed the steps to the next level to find the front door. As it was so late we could not get anything to eat either at the hotel or anywhere around it, despite the best efforts of the reception staff. Things looked up in the morning; we took the free shuttle bus to the metro and went about the city from there. We returned to the hotel exhausted from sightseeing on both days, not wanting to venture out again. This meant we ate there on two nights. The first was Sunday and they had been entertaining a children's party all afternoon, so I think the staff were pretty frazzled when it came to dinner service. The menu was rather limited and a couple of things had run out, so choice was not great; my wife's ham salad was very disappointing. But what a contrast on the next night; we had a very pleasant meal of chateaubriand. Breakfasts on all three mornings were excellent with plenty of choice, the scrambled egg was superb. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout. I agree with another reviewer the bedrooms were rather dated but spotlessly clean and a comfortable bed. All in all, it was a great base for our stay and much better value than any more central hotels I have previously used. Oh yes, and free wifi too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to get away from hustle”
Reviews.Author: Hulacowgirl
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with hospitable staff. Food was excellent. Loved their breakfast and pasta at dinner! Both the kids and parents truly enjoyed their pasta pomodoro and carbonara! Location is a bit far from any sites but was nice to get away from the mounds of tourists. Walked to nearby restaurants, shops, fruit stands and gelateria frequented by locals...much better experience than eating and shopping in city center (better value and got to try my hand at speaking Italian) Thankful for shuttle. We used the Roma cristiana tour bus which meets at the Vatican so it worked out well for us to get around town. Would recommend if you want a little peacefulness at the end of the day but if you want to stay in the mix of things..not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but slightly dated”
Reviews.Author: Betsy364
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights here whilst visiting the sights of Rome. A fantastic trip and a comfy hotel. The continental breakfast was a treat for anyone who likes proscuitto as the host will bring you a mountain of it freshly cooked if requested to accompany your fresh roles, pastries, fruit etc. The room we stayed in was slightly dated in style but clean and comfortable. An added bonus was the balcony with views across Rome (althought not really the panorama of St Peters as implied) and also a complimentary bottle of red wine from the hotel manager. The room also had a bath with shower and the room had a sofa and a mini bar too. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout and lent us a travel adaptor when requested and booked us a seat on their shuttle bus into central Rome on one of the mornings, although we walked most of the time. The walk is not for the faint hearted as it's probably 30mins from Roma centre and an uphill climb back at the end of a long day. The hotel is near a bus route but we didnt manage to get organised enough to take the bus and always just opted to walk it, with regret once half way home... However, our reward was a drink sitting in the hotel garden which was very nice. Overall the hotel was nice enough with an air of grandeur but we both agreed that we would happily give up some of the niceties to have a 'not so nice' room more central to Rome itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel 10 minutes from the city center”
Reviews.Author: aronuz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel only for one night, but did enjoy it. Big room, clean bathroom. Free WiFi. One of the best breakfasts I've ever had at a hotel. Easy to get to the center of Rome, two buses pass nearby. Stuff is very friendly and is very good with their English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: scottiei
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Rome staying at this hotel, as stated in other reviews it is a bit far out but the free shuttle(book in advance) provided is excellent and only takes 10 - 15 mins to arrive at the Vatican, once there plenty of forms of transportation to get you around the sites. The 990 bus stops very close to the hotel and there are restaurants close by if you want to eat out. Rooms clean and spacious. Breakfast was very good and staff were extremely helpful. We didn't eat in the restaurant. Great value for money. Tip if you plan on visiting the Vatican museums - free admission on the last Sunday of the month, however very busy .

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff, restaurant good”
Reviews.Author: RogFCambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: The staff in this place (largely Albanian, English good to excellent) derive obvious pleasure in providing the best service they possibly can - and this makes staying here a joy. The breakfasts are the best I've had in a continental Europe hotel (want something you can't see on the buffet? Just ask). The evening meals are limited in range, but impressive in quality - the steaks in particular are exceptional, and I've heard good things about the prawns. (Translation hints: "green peppers" = peppercorns, "red peppers" = chilli.) Rooms vary in size and whether they have access to a balcony and a view, but beds are large and comfortable and the plumbing works well. Television small (30cm?) but why come to Rome to watch TV? Soundproofing effective. Wifi works well for e-mail and browsing, wouldn't suggest trying to stream any entertainment. Located in a quiet residential area on a hill above the centre. Walking to and from the centre is quite practical if you're fit - I've done it several times - but the free minibus works well if you book it the day before (don't forget to book the return trip if you need it), and there are several frequent public bus routes into the city within 10 minutes walk - learn how to use them. Will definitely stay here if I come this way again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience-would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: dokeydog1973
Reviews.Content: After much research, I used AA miles to book two rms for five days this past week (12-17 March) for my family of five. First, Gennaro was as advertised in regards to the excellent breakfast experience. His personal touch of making sure everything was as expected was to be commended. His stories about growing up in Napoli made the trip for my eight yr old son. My folks were especially impressed by how he remembered what foods they liked during their first morning breakfast and how Gennaro had plates of salami, cheeses and pastries waiting for them at a table the following morning. Secondly, the rooms were impeccably clean. It felt great after a long day of touring to come back to a tidy room. Thirdly, the front desk service, especially Stefano and Gabrielle, were especially kind in giving directions in/around the area. The ease of the shuttle service saved us some $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: roxy8203
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a deal I booked for 3 nights in Rome. This hotel isnt close to the centre of Rome but the transport is good. The hotel provides a transfer bus to either the metro or the vatican, which has to be booked the night before. We used this service everyday. The rooms were fine, the decor could be updated but the amount of time we spent there it really didnt matter. It was clean and the staff were very friendly, especially at breakfast. The only tip I would give is if you eat there in the evening either pay and retain a reciept or pay for everything when you leave. We ate there on the sunday night and paid for it but the next night we ate there and they said we should pay when we leave, so we accepted that. When we went to check out and pay for mondays meal they told us we had not paid for sundays and charged us twice, as we didnt have a reciept they wouldnt accept they were wrong and made us pay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ELOUISE186273
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 15th – 20th Feb 2012. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. The hotel offers a free return shuttle bus service to the Vatican City each day - this is very useful as well as being prompt and reliable. The walk from the drop off point to the centre of Rome is around 15 mins. Very pleasant walk. The breakfast is fabulous! Gennora offers a wonderful selection of food. He is very professional, friendly and charming. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An acceptable 3 star in a quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: coopdawg99
Reviews.Content: First thing to be ready for is a lengthy taxi ride from the airport, probably 45 - 50 minutes plus the time the taxi driver was lost for! Arrived on a Sunday evening (22nd Jan) at around 9.00pm, hotel was almost empty but the staff were still attentive and helpful, which was the case for the entire stay. I presume it to be because of the off season but it really was like we were the only people there, I did not see any other guests but could hear some people above us. Breakfast was fine, the chef would cook eggs or bacon on request whilst there was a full range of cereals, breads and juices available. Restaurant was always closed by the time we got back from sightseeing but to be fair, we always returned quite late as the hotel is a lengthy bus ride or taxi ride from the centre of town. Never a 4 star rating but a decent 3 star in my book. Rooms always clean, staff always pleasant and helpful, bathrooms well equipped and a nice large bedroom with lots of storage, good bed too!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: evian232
Reviews.Content: We have travelled all over the world stayed in hotels and timeshares. The service we received from the reception to the maids and restaurant staff was A+++. Mr gennaro motto was if there is anything that is not on the buffet table just ask him he will provide .His pleasant nature and impeccable customer service was outstanding.Rooms were average in appearance bathrooms large,modern nice decor.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: travelingchef33
Reviews.Content: stayed at this particular hotel in early september 2011. very nice an comfortable hotel. the staff was pleasant. it was a bit far from the center of rome, but, if you ask the front desk for the public transportation routes...it will help alot. almost forgot...the elevators were a bit small

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: FabrizioD71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a Congress in Rome (recommended hotel in brochure). Reception staff (Stefano & Sakis) and driver of hotel shuttle bus (Ernesto) very helpful, friendly, efficient and to be highly commended. Nice quiet location with neat and tidy room with added bonus of free wireless internet connection. Buffet breakfast excellent. Would stay again if travel to Rome purely for value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I wen to Rome for a wedding. The rooms were well presented and the location of the hotel was really good. The staff were very nice especially Gennaro who runs the breakfast service. He was always very friendly and put together a fantastic breakfast for us every day. I can highly recommend this hotel if you plan on going to Rome for a few days. And make sure you get up in the morning for a breakfast from Gennaro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuart R
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here at the end of an European holiday. This was clearly the best hotel we stayed in on the continent. The rooms were clean and quite large. The food was good and there was a large selection for breakfast. The reception staff were really helpful and Alessandro,Roberto and Dario were really good in the bar and the dining room. The hotel is quite close to the CBD. I can recommend this hotel to any one visiting Rome and If I return I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Snbjason
Reviews.Content: Went there from south Italy for sight seeing in Rome for 3 days with 5 friends. We booked 2 rooms online. Pros:Very quiet, clean, helpfull staff, great breakfast buffet Cons: Had to walk to get to the nearest bus or subway station. Expensive and poor dinner. Suburban area so no that much of a view.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were considerate and helpful given my gender issues.”
Reviews.Author: rachael0000000000000
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel 4th July to 10th July with my female friend I was most concerned that my gender identity (disphoria) issues would be a factor in my stay for I am a male pre-op transsexual. Nothing could be further from the truth. I was accepted from day one as a female. The reception staff were always helpful and referred to me as Madame, The restaurant staff equally so especially Gennaro. He is to be commended for his diligence, efficiency and attention to detail. Many thanks Robert (Rachael) Young.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel and staff so friendly and helpful now been 7 times love it”
Reviews.Author: benjihepp
Reviews.Content: all staff excellent, gennaro very helpful and friendly all staff cannot do enought for you, we will be going back next year love you all xx

Reviews.Title: “Great value...Hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Doppelganger24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is advertised as a 4 star; however. it is probably closer to a mid range 3 star, if that. The Pros: Excellent value. We were able to get a room for two nights for a 120 euros including breakfast. For Rome, this price could not be beat in high season. Breakfast was simply excellent. By far the best complimentary breakfast we encountered on the entire trip that included several cities and two countries. Cleanliness. The rooms and, especially the bathroom was clean and fairly spacious by European standards. Hotel Restaurant/Bar was quite good and very reasonably priced. My wife claims it has the best lasagna in Rome! The staff were incredibly helpful and generally went out of their way to help us. In addition, the front desk staff generally spoke English which was a big help. The shuttle bus was an added bonus, especially due to the location. Be warned that a reservation is required in advance! Cons: Location. It is way out of the way in a city that does not have the best mass transit system. In addition, the hotel is very far from the nearest Metro/FM station. That made getting to the hotel the first time quite difficult. Best bet is to get a taxi from the FM3 train station. Beds were extremely hard. I like firm, but the beds in room 405 were like sleeping on a marble slate. Internet is free, but the wireless is slow and the signal is never really good in the rooms. There is a hotspot in the lounge that seemed to work very well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Access from Rome long & difficult.”
Reviews.Author: MaryB53
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel - friendly staff, reasonable rooms and very clean. Breakfast was good and we had a 'free bar' offer with our stay which was very good, covering everything from beer to cocktails. However, access to and from Rome and/or the Vatican City is not easy. If you use the bus it is an extremely busy one and, after a journey of 20 mins +, the stop is a good 5 mins walk from the hotel. We were quoted 28 euros for a taxi fare. Although the hotel restaurant is fairly good, there are no other facilities within walking distance (unless we missed them). The shuttle bus took us to the Vatican each morning but was not, unfortunately, running on an evening. For access reasons alone I would, regretfully, be unlikely to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AlmostRetiredNiagara
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in more of a residential area but this was fine for us as we were on a bus tour and the bus took us to all of the treasures of Rome. The hotel rooms were a little small but no problem. The hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly, two of the most important items that we look for in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon074
Reviews.Content: Positive: Value for money! Very nice, helpful, attentive staff. Clean, spacious bathroom. Good breakfast and very pleasant dining room. The window in the room had curtains and blinders so you can make it totally dark at night. The neighborhood is 100% safe and quiet so it's no problem AT ALL to walk around at night (though bear in mind there are no buses after 12pm). Very easy to get from this hotel to the city center via bus or free hotel shuttle (once or twice a day they offer a shuttle that takes you to the Vatican or metro station). There are several buses you can take that arrive every few minutes and at least one of them takes you to the city center, the others take you to the metro station (20-25 minutes ride to the metro station, and about 4 minutes metro ride to the center) You can see the bus routes and timetables at http://www.atac.roma. We found the info to be totally accurate. Negative: Not within walking distance from the metro (there's an urban rail station nearby but the websites and hotel staff insist the buses are better so we never tried it). The first night we heard the next door room had their TV on all night and you can also hear the rooms around you if their noisy. Although you only wait a few minutes for the bus, it can get very crowded. It's not too bad (no pickpockets or anything), just a little uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben5England
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, with a location conveniently close to Rome and the Vatican City. The hotel was clean and the food was of high standard. A shuttle-bus runs from the hotel to the Vatican. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at the top of the hill!”
Reviews.Author: ajbwcd
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with the hotel and our stay there. While it is not centrally located it did help us get in some daily exercise! The hotel was clean and cozy. The rooms were well decorated and allowed for relaxation. The bathroom was cozy and we loved having a heater in there to help with keeping the towels warm. The restaurant had wonderful dinners and we enjoyed them when we could. The breakfast buffett offered friendly staff and many options to choose from. The front desk staff was helpful and cheerful and provided us with maps and other information. The shuttle service was convenient in the mornings, but didn't utilize the evening returns. My only suggestion about the shuttle service would be a mid day shuttle return around 3 or so for those that choose to come back to the hotel early. All in all we were sad to leave these accomodations, but glad to have experienced them!

Reviews.Title: “Peace, comfort and quiet amidst the chaos!”
Reviews.Author: thetimSwindon
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay at the Park Dei Massim and we would recommend highly. Above all the things that strike you about the hotel is how it in the midst of a noisy and chaotically overcrowded (although stunningly beautiful city) the hotel manages to exude an air of peace, quiet and calm. The hotel is situated approx 1.5 miles from the nearest metro (Cipro) so in that regard fairly central yet it seems otherwise in terms of its tranquil ambience. We were given a comfortable room on the 2nd floor which was spacious and easily adequate for our stay. The hotel has a leafy and well kept garden and our balcony overlooked this so early evenings in could be enjoyed simply relaxing in the beautiful balmy late summer Rome weather. The hotel operates a free shuttle at 3 intervals in the morning and again once in the evening, if you have some energy left at the end of a days sightseeing!? you can walk back to the hotel from Cipro Metro in about 20-25 mins. Once you've established your way its actually not too bad to try although there is a gradual incline all the way from the metro station back to the hotel. Otherwise if you wish to stay in town later in the evening you probably need to taxi from Metro (app 15euros) or bus. Our stay wasn t long enough to get round to trying the latter. Back to the hotel the standard of service and cleanliness couldnt really be faulted and we were welcomed well by reception who orientated us with useful information and maps. Breakfast was fresh, varied and plentiful and we tried the restaurant on one occasion again being satisfied with food and service. In summary the Park Dei Massimi served us very well and provided a comfortable, welcoming refuge at the end of each day of doing the sights!

Reviews.Title: “Great out of the way hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenlaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, small and intimate, good staff, great breakfast buffet, but VERY FAR from town center. Had to taxi twice a day. The shuttle is somewhat helpful but only has 2 drop off points. The surrounding neighborhood is quiet and lovely. ALSO, if you have a large group-the pull out beds are horribly uncomfortable but regular beds are fine.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View on the 4th of July”
Reviews.Author: CAHumboldter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three days before our cruise. Nice hotel on a hitll away from the hustle and chaos of downtown Rome. We liked staying here as you could relax have a beer or glass of wine in the garden area and it was nice and quiet after a busy day in Rome. The hotel offers a shuttle that was prompt and convenient at dropping us off and picking us up near the Vatican and tour buses. Room was decent sized (210) and nice to have a balcony. Dinner was good in the restaurant but happy hour cocktails and lounge food was a great value and 1/2 priced. Breakfast was great, the best food of all three hotels we stayed in Italy. ..and that says a lot. After a busy day in Rome we were winding down and noticed fireworks outside our balcony window. As proud Americans, we all went out on the balcony and had a great view of the fireworks which lasted for about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hamm0nd
Reviews.Content: Although breakfast was provided it was of poor quality, fruit wasn't fresh and there were very few options available. Location is not a ten minute walk from vatican city as advertised on the website. More like half an hour for an able bodied person. Although shuttle buses to vatican city and the metro were in place in the mornings the latest return was half six which was far to early. Public transport is available and is cheap and efficient however feel the hotel could offer a better service. No nightlife in immediate vicinity. There were no tea making facilities in the room. Hotel was exceptionally clean and tidy. The staff were friendly and helpful. The shutters on the windows were fantastic for afternoon siesta. The garden was well kept. In our opinion this hotel is not to the standard expected of a four star hotel..sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaItalylover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The staff is very helpful. They were friendly and helped us get around. Simone (sp?) at the front desk was extremely helpful and friendly. Free Internet as well. The breakfast is very good and included. Gennaro, one of the breakfast staff, was excellent and very engaging. He made our breakfast time very interesting and entertaining. We would recommend this hotel for it's service and value. Location is not great but if you're not concerned about walking you can get to good restaurants (the one near the train station was worth the walk). If you're not afraid to ride the Metro Buses you can get anywhere in Rome very cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for the Money, great service”
Reviews.Author: anthonyn66
Reviews.Content: Pros: The service was very, very good. They helped us a lot, especially when it came to items we needed. We forgot a toothbrush and they provided us with some, and same thing with packing tape. They are very kind and welcoming. The dining was pretty good, and the prices were very affordable. The restaurant is quite helpful if you just came back from a long trip, and you don't want to look for food. Breakfast is complete, filling, and has great variety, with many Italian and even some American foods. It is far from traffic areas, making it quiet. The shuttle makes the location factor less of a big deal. The rooms were very clean, and the maids do a great job cleaning it up. Free wi-fi, but slow. Cons: It's location is far from the City Center, and many attractions, however, every morning you can book a free shuttle (7:30, 8:30, 9:30, 10:30) that takes you to the Metro station or the Vatican (Piazza Risogimento which is close to the museum and St. Peter's Basilica). No swimming pool, but it's Rome, and you probably won't go to swim anyways. The food takes a long time to make. TV is small. Those, however, are minor problems. I was very satisfied with the hotel, and for the money, I think it's one of the best hotels you could get for that price, considering the fact that many of the better hotels are priced at $250. Great hotel, great people, great food, great value. By the way, when you book, book on their website, because you don't have to pay the tax. Also, I heard their getting a swimming pool and possibly tennis courts and mini-soccer fields. I really want this hotel again the next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Park dei Massimis - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BoBoBaby
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights. The staff were friendly and very accomodating. The rooms were very clean and cozy. We had the quad room, our kids loved watching Scooby Doo in Italian. The food at this Hotel was incredible! We dined every night at the hotel resteraunt and the service was impecable. The prices were reasonable too. After a tiring day of touring, it was nice to just walk downstairs to dinner. Most of the local resteraunts were closed for the season or didn't open until after 8:00 in the evening. (not feasible with kids) The buffet breakfast and service was just as good too . The service and food was so good, why would we go anywhere else? The location was just outside the city center. They do provide a shuttle to the Vatican Center which was nice. It's about a 20-25 minute ride by shuttle. A taxi was a 10-15 minute ride, but you have to hang on for dear life! We will certainly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eternal Rome ! A good place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: GinnyConneticut
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for five nights . Our room wasn't so big but TV , shower, direct phone , mini bar etc. were in it. Room 506 was very nice and in excellent, clean condition , A/C worked well. Throw our window we could see a Rome's large part included St. Peter and the unexpected garden around the hotel where we spent time to take sun ! At breakfast , a " big " one , Gennaro was always very kind and friendly. The check in staff go out their way to be helpful. So , staff , breakfast , location and price , all was great . Well, we saw St. Peter , some historical places , Museum , do shopping. looking for a good hotel this is amazing ! No very expansive : a coffee €. 1 at actual change about $ 1,5 , a beer €.4 means $ 6. We back home happy ! Thanks Letizia

Reviews.Title: “Problem with Staff, poor price/quality relation”
Reviews.Author: GTSA
Reviews.Content: Poor price/quality relation. Poor quality for a 4 star hotel. In the last day, i suposedly left a pair of sun glasses near the entrance. The staff at the reception said they saw the sun glasses. They did nothing to keap them safe, allowing them to be stealed. I was even under the impression they were connected to the theft, as they did no effort to help me finding them, and only told they saw them after beeing asked for the second time. the worst part of my trip to rome, that otherwise went really well. Very nice city, worth visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: norwtrav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at Park Hotel Dei Massimi. I brought a local map downloaded from the Internet to help the taxidriver to find the Hotel. He sure did needed it. It really is a good hotel in a quiet neighborhood. Nice, clean room and a helpful staff. Average breakfast. The room had a balcony, a big plus. And, yes, as other rewiewers we felt that the distance to the main attractions in Rome was too long. We don't mind walk a few miles, but we do prefer to do that in the city centre. There is a bus stop not to far away, but for us it took to long to find out about it. So the Hotel shuttle bus was an option. We used it every day. I guess we could stay at this hotel again, that due to the low price. But perhaps a more central hotel will be better, simply to have more access to the outdoor life in the evenings and nigh time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value bur hard to find”
Reviews.Author: mdryden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned after a three night stay and, on the whole, were happy with the hotel. The room we had was very clean and nicely decorated with a beautiful spotless bathroom. The main downside was the location. It was hard to find a decent place to eat within walking distance at night and taxi drivers had to use sat-nav all the time to locate the hotel.Tip....always carry the address and postcode or taxi drivers dont have a clue. The shuttle bus in the morning is handy but I feel that a service throughout the day would be a bonus - the last one left the hotel at 10.10 which was fine until the day we were checking out and wanted to stay in room later. Also an English speaking TV channel would be appreciated. We only had breakfast in the hotel and this was OK - not startling but adequate....as previous reports stated the waiter Gennaro was a delight....his sunny smile brightened up the place. This was my third visit to Rome and I would recommend staying at a more central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller265
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Park Hotel and found the service excellent, the room was very comfortable and very nice to relax. The breakfast was excellent and the waiters and staff very friendly and helpful specially Gennaro who not only made the guest feel at home but also his tips on places of interest in Rome and nothing was too much trouble. When visiting Rome again, we will book this Hotel and will be recommending it to our friends who want to visit Rome. The Pereira Family

Reviews.Title: “best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: traveller213
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel dei Massimi with my wife and two kids when visiting Rome. We selected this hotel based on the excellent reviews on Expedia and Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Despite the fact that it is qualified as a four-star hotel, at the time of the booking it was one of the less expensive hotels on Expedia. The hotel is somewhat out of the way - the bus stop for the city bus is about 10 minutes' walk and it takes another 15 to get to the Vatican, or another 25-30 to get downtown - it is still a very good deal. A weekly bus pass costs about $25, much less than the difference in price between this hotel and others of comparable quality. The service is great, the staff is helpful and the rooms are clean. The breakfast is excellent: there is a huge selection and it makes the hotel an outstanding value. The head of the breakfast team, Mr. Gennaro, requires special mention. Because of jetlag we overslept and only went downstairs at noon. As soon as he heard about it, he treated the four of us to a full breakfast. He also helped us when we had to leave early in the morning to catch our flight. I would certainly stay in this hotel during my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: wonald
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights here in July 2007 as part of my Cosmos tour. I paid a single supplement and was given Room 601 which is a double with a convertible sofa. There is only one other room on the 6th floor (602) and three people were staying there during my stay. It's on the roof of the hotel and I got half of the roof for my terrace with views of Vatican City in the distance. Only con was that there is no elevator to the 6th floor: you have to go to the 5th floor and climb up a flight of stairs. Despite what the hotel and travel guides say, the hotel is ditched among the hills to the far north. There was no good restaurants nearby and the hotel restaurant was expensive. Using the free shuttle to the Octaviano Metro stop is a must but I would much rather be at a more centrally located hotel. Nice free breakfast and friendly staff. Internet service was down while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: MSZV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July 2007 for 3 nights with my husband. We enjoyed our stay very much, decor was good and clean, breakfast was good too. Not very central but shuttle/public buses will take you to the centre. Rome is best explored on foot anyway, so be prepared to walk. Hotel staff very helpful and polite. We had a lovely time in Rome. Do some research before you go to avoid going to touristy restaurants, we found food in general are of very good standard and value. Must try the pizzas at Da Bufetta near Navona Piazza. Also try to follow the instructions from the hotel website for the public transport to get to the hotel to avoid expensive taxifares. Taxi at taxi stands still don't always have meters.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificó”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth_Innes
Reviews.Content: visited 14th to the 18th Mar; absoloutly excelent hotel, excelent food, friendly staff, free shuttle busses morning and evenings. Rooms were spotlessly clean, beds were massive, would recomend this hotel to anyone who wants to escape the noise of rome. Taxi from centre of rome to hotel was €7.50 during the day and €12.50 after 7:00p.m. Approx. 1 1/2 mile from Vatican City and the center of rome - 10-15 minutes journey by taxi/bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and lovely City”
Reviews.Author: majorjim
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome on a 3 day visit last week 14-17 Feb 2007. Hotel was excellent with very helpful staff. They also had a shuttle bus to the Vatican and return each day. Food was very good especialy breakfast. Hotel is only about 2.5 kms away from Vatican. Great 3 days and we intend to return to Rome it is a fascinating city with friendly people of all nationalities. We rate the hotel as first class and recommend it to anyone going to Rome. It is not expensive but this of course will depend on the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel but not near metro or bus line”
Reviews.Author: ric123461
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing wrong with the hotel, well mold in a couple different bathrooms but thats rome and for a cheap hotel the accomodations and breakfest where not that bad. I would not stay here again because of the location and you will blow money on taxis and of my opinion and the other 15-20 in our party, the hotel was not worth the hassle. Get a hotel on the metro line somewhere even if its not near downtown. If the hotel is near a metro stop, then accessibility to anything in rome is easy. This hotel was not and I would not recommend any tourists of any type to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated far away from Vatican. You will need 1,5 hours to reach the center of Rome. The rooms are tiny. The region is awful. Avoid it...

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hotel dei Massimi
HotelInfo.Address: Largo Vincenzo Ambrosio 9, 00136 Rome, Italy
